# Automated App Signing of Secured Android & iOS Apps on Appdome

Last updated July 17, 2025 by Appdome

Learn about Automated App Signing Options for secured Android & iOS Apps using Appdome.

## Automated App Signing Options for Secured Android & iOS Apps

Both Google and Apple require signing their mobile apps (for Android and iOS environment, respectively) before they can be installed on a mobile device. A valid signature ensures the integrity of an app and stands as proof that the app has not been tampered with. Many individuals sign within their development and integration platform, but some are required to sign the applications on designated computers in order to preserve the signing credentials within a trusted environment.

## Why Sign Secured Apps on Appdome

As an Appdome user, you can sign any built app either by using Appdome’s built-in signing capabilities or using your own mechanism outside of Appdome. You are encouraged, however, to use the built-in app signing service on Appdome, because this service includes multiple input validation mechanisms to ensure proper signing.

Appdome allows you to Securely Automate iOS/Android App Signing within a CI/CD without uploading the signing certificate to Appdome’s cloud service. Using Appdome, Signing secured mobile apps is easy, effortless, and does not require any prior knowledge.

Appdome supports app signing for any development environment, framework and platform, including Native Android and iOS apps, hybrid apps and non-native apps built in Maui, Xamarin, Cordova, and React Native, Ionic, and more. On Appdome, you can also sign an iOS application that contains extensions such as WatchKit, Share, Notification, File and Documents Providers and more.  This robust implementation cuts deployment cycles and allows one to sign applications from a third-party vendor.

We hope you find this knowledge base useful and enjoy using Appdome!
